abstract: Cable and Wireless Communications of Britain agreed on Monday to sell a number of businesses to the phone operator Batelco Group of Bahrain for up to $1 billion.
lead_paragraph: Cable and Wireless Communications of Britain agreed on Monday to sell a number of businesses to the phone operator Batelco Group of Bahrain for up to $1 billion. The deal includes the sale of assets in the Maldives, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and the Seychelles, as well as part of Cable & Wireless’s stake in Monaco Telecom, for a combined $680 million. The Batelco Group also has the option to acquire the remaining holding of Monaco Telecom owned by Cable and Wireless for an additional $345 million, subject to regulatory approval. Read more »

headline.main: Cable and Wireless to Sell Units for Up to $1 Billion
